result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Grill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants Huber and good time.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on 3/30/2016.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Hours to be completed within the 1st 6 months of probation which is in lieu of 13 days jail.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants Huber and good time.
Consecutive to: Count 3.
Concurrent with: Count 3 together with conditions (excluding Community Service Condition)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin D Grill

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin D Grill in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend counts 3 & 4 to 961.41(3g)(e) a misd (without modifier).  Court grants amendments. 
Defendant pleads guilty to amended counts. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 
Count 3: 6 months jail with Huber and good time - STAYED 
2 Years Probation - IMPOSED  - Must report to probation by 3/30/16 by 3:00 PM. 
100 hours of Community Service to be completed within the 1st 6 months of probation which is in lieu of 13 days jail.  
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Costs including $180.00 in buy money. 

Count 4: 6 months jail with Huber and good time - Consecutive to count 3 - STAYED. 
2 Years Probation - Concurrent to count 3- IMPOSED 
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Costs 

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court - 4/2/16.

Defendant Justin D Grill in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement reached. Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

  Plea hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Information was filed today.
Defendant pleads NG to both counts.
Bond to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Justin D Grill in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Harrington relates defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  Court reviews Complaint, finds probable cause and binds defendant over on Counts 3 and 4. 
  Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Attorney Fees - $100.00 per month by wage assignment beginning 09/30/2015 - Andrew Harrington

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Justin D Grill in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Blue form presented.  Court appoints Andrew Harrington and orders repayment of $100.00 per month beginning 9/30/15.  Reading of Complaint waived.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
